Monster Farm DS Official Perfect Guide
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher DS Archive (DS): Japanese DS Games Archive: Monster Farm DS: Misc. Q&A (post all new topics here, we'll make more sections later): Monster Farm DS Official Perfect Guide
By GM on Tuesday, September 4, 2007 - 10:29 am:

It just so happens that Kaite Shabette Hajimeyo! Monster Farm DS Official Perfect Guide (yay, formatting!), published by Enterbrain, was released just a few days ago on the last day of August. According to its Play-Asia product page, it has a healthy 175 pages of content, possibly including item values and such. I can't really make anything out barring the number of pages and size format (A5).

Pick it up when you can, Lisa!

By GM on Friday, September 14, 2007 - 09:38 pm:

Good to know.

Say, could you possibly tell us how to unlock Beaklon today? I've
been quite curious for a while.

By Lisa Shock on Friday, September 14, 2007 - 09:52 pm:

It has something to do with touching a yellow crystal on the ranch itself after the year 2005. Apparently, there are two blue crystals both to the right of the barn and one yellow crystal, near the tree, on the ranch itself. I am trying to figure out how to 'touch' them.

By Lisa Shock on Friday, September 14, 2007 - 10:04 pm:

Ok, you can use a stylus to move around the ranch like on a venture. You can find items in blue crystals. You may also find a yellow one after year 1005 month 8, after touching it you have unlocked Beaclon.

By Lisa Shock on Friday, September 14, 2007 - 10:59 pm:

I unlocked it in the second week of the 8th month. I was able to get the rare Orchestron at the shrine thereafter.

By Lisa Shock on Friday, September 14, 2007 - 11:10 pm:

I should add that I sent two different monsters around every week from Jan/4 til I got it on Aug/2. It MIGHT have to be unlocked in august, not certain. Just venture on the ranch til you find a yellow crystal. Also, the income from the blue crystals comes in very handy.

By GM on Friday, September 14, 2007 - 11:18 pm:

By Thorr on Tuesday, October 9, 2007 - 08:41 pm:

Confirmation of Beaklon - I couldn't get it in July, but I could get it august. The real pain in the butt about beaclon is getting your monster to actually pick up the yellow crystal. The crystal is behind the tree. When you attempt to tap it, it's so close to the menu that you end up hitting the End option. Even if you get that out of the way, there is a very small tappable area that will actually get your monster to acquire the crystal. But, once you do, a Beaklon flies to your Tree and lands there. Once the event happens, Beaklon is unlocked at the shrine.

By Lisa Shock on Wednesday, October 10, 2007 - 11:38 am:

I will add that I had the same problem with being close to the menu/tiny tapping area.

By Thorr on Friday, October 12, 2007 - 05:11 am:

Got my copy of the book now, too. Huge thanks to my benefactor!

I have been looking through it quickly (since I have only had it for about 10 minutes so far) and it looks like there are 2 special monsters that can only be acquired via GBA Cartridge Regeneration -
87 - Cinderbird (Monster Farm Advance 2 J)
90 - Gus (Monster Farm Advance J)

Of course, I only have the English versions of these games.. Time to do some hardcore bargain hunting. I imagine that an English version of the game would use the USA versions instead, but since that isn't a definite release, I will likely go crazy trying to get these monsters (unless a cheat device can be used for them, which I want to avoid).
